title: WTB / WTT4 19th Century Detroit Cards & Memorabilia
author: Joe_G.

posts.post_title: WTB / WTT4 19th Century Detroit Cards & Memorabilia
posts.post_content:
I need one or more Old Judge poses of the following players with Detroit:

Lady Baldwin
[STRIKE]Count Campau[/STRIKE]
Pete Conway
Charlie Getzien
[STRIKE]Barney Gilligan[/STRIKE]
Mike Goodfellow
Frank Scheibeck
Deacon White

I'm aggressively trying to hunt down these final poses.

I'm also always interested in all Detroit N173s, N175s, Tomlinson Cabinets, and N333 SF Hess Newsboys (all teams, not just Detroit).  Any 19th century Detroit card/cabinet, letter, scorecard, memorabilia, etc. likely interests me.  Cash and quality trade material, Detroit and otherwise, among the possibilities.

Thank You!,
Joe G.
[url]detroitwolverines@gmail.com[/url]
Friendly bump, have more trade material than shown.

Bump, now have another couple dozen OJs for trade material including some tougher players.

I'm especially interested in Gilligan w/ Detroit.

[quote name="Joe_G." post=1295972]Bump, now have another couple dozen OJs for trade material including some tougher players.

I'm especially interested in Gilligan w/ Detroit.[/QUOTE]

Wait, I thought I was the only one looking for Gilligan. :D

joe
2 year bump, my wantlist remains the same.  Thank you!
Joe, do you have the pose numbers?  If so, that might help people figure out if they have what you need.   Yeah, I'm missing every pose of Deacon White..:p

Hello Fred,

I'm down to needing a single pose on a couple guys like Campau and Conway while most others are at two poses needed.  I guess my journey is most incomplete on White.  Of his 8 poses (I'm not counting McGreachery), I have four N172s, one N173, and three as Studio Proofs with overlapped coverage on poses leaving two poses unaccounted for.  It would be nice to have them all as N172s but that is one of many near impossible challenges presented by Goodwin & Co.

I'm interested in all poses of these tough guys as I seek upgrades and trade material.  Trading for a Deacon White is often easier if you are offering a Deacon White.

Another 2 year bump :)

I was able to cross off Gilligan earlier this year, many thanks to Troy Kirk.  Still need one or more poses of the guys listed and of course interested in just about anything 19th century Detroit related.

Thank you for looking.

It's been well over a year, time for a bump.

Some great pick-ups and trades with Jay M., John S., & Joe M. have allowed me to mark off 4 cards since I last wrote.  Down to single poses needed for Baldwin, Conway, Getzien, and Scheibeck.
